headline: Comstock Resources to Report Q4 Earnings: What's in the Cards?
summary: CRK heads into Q4 earnings with solid revenue growth expected, but consensus EPS points to a sharp year-over-year decline despite higher gas prices.

headline: Important Factors to Watch Ahead of BP's Q4 Earnings Release
summary: BP heads into Q4 earnings with higher revenue expectations and a projected EPS rebound, as lower crude prices pressure upstream but support refining.

headline: Enterprise Products Partners Balances Record 2025 Results With Future Growth Prospects
summary: Enterprise Products Partners (NYSE:EPD) reported record operational and financial results for 2025. New assets were added and long term agreements were signed with major partners, including ExxonMobil. The company plans lower capital expenditures in 2026 after a period of heavy investment. Management expects stronger growth in 2027 as recently completed projects are more fully utilized. EPD announced an expanded share repurchase program and marked its 27th consecutive annual distribution...

headline: Agilyx, ExxonMobil and LyondellBasell to split up chemical recycling joint venture
summary: The companies will restructure Cyclyx International. Agilyx will take ownership of the Dallas-area circularity center, while ExxonMobil and LyondellBasell will own the Houston location.

raw.headline: Agilyx, ExxonMobil and LyondellBasell to split up chemical recycling joint venture

summary: SBM Offshore will manage operations and maintenance until 2035.

headline: ExxonMobil Refocuses Portfolio With Colombia Deal And Fife Plant Closure
summary: Exxon Mobil (NYSE:XOM) and Sintana Energy reached an arbitration settlement tied to assets in Colombia, resulting in an asset transfer agreement. ExxonMobil is permanently closing and decommissioning its Fife Ethylene Plant in Scotland, ending operations at the long running petrochemical facility. For you as an investor, these moves sit at the intersection of upstream options and legacy refining and chemicals exposure. The Colombia resolution removes a legal overhang around exploration...

headline: The $100 Billion Bet on Venezuelan Oil Relies on a Broken State Company
summary: Foreign energy companies are facing a legal minefield dealing with PdVSA, which has long been accused of corruption.
